VariableDescription.Name: vx_rpy
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Ion drift in S/C LVLH coordinates > x component = along the S/C trajectory vector
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           ROCSAT-1(FORMOSAT-1)/IPEI CDF FORMAT
#     PROJECT                         ROCSAT(FORMOSAT)
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Studies
#     SOURCE_NAME                     ROCSAT-1(FORMOSAT-1)>Ionospheric Plasma and Electrodynamics Instrument
#     DESCRIPTOR                      IPEI>Ionospheric Plasma and Electrodynamics Instrument
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            1-second averaged data
#                                     ***Important Notes*** on Accuracy of VperpM_MF (meridional),VperpZ_MF (zonal),                         
#                                      and VparaMF (parallel) components.                                                                    
#                                     Geophysical flow components VperpM_MF, VperpZ_MF, and VparaMF are converted                            
#                                      from flow velocities, Vx, Vy, and Vz                                                                  
#                                     measured in the S/C coordinate system. Vx points along the S/C trajectory vector,                      
#                                      Vz is in the nadir direction,                                                                         
#                                     and Vy points to the right of the S/C trajectory vector (in the anti-angular                           
#                                      momentum direction).                                                                                  
#                                     1) Vx, Vy, and Vz are measured flow velocities at S/C coordinate in the Earth-centered                 
#                                      Inertia Coordinate System (non-rotating) (ECI coordinate).                                            
#                                     2) VperZ_MF, VperM_MF, and VparaMF are geophysical flows in the Earth-centered                         
#                                      Fixed Coordinated System (rotate with the Earth) (ECF coordinate).                                    
#                                     3) Uncertainty of +-(37.8-75.45) m/s in Vx based on 0.5% - 1% error in fitting                         
#                                      could be introduced to all geophysical flow components.                                               
#                                     4) VperpM_MF at low latitude is almost identical to (-Vz). No Vx is included                           
#                                      so that it is very reliable.                                                                          
#                                     5) Uncertainties from Vx could exist in VperpZ_MF and VparaMF.
#                                     6) VperpZ_MF and VparaMF can be used to study the relative changes in flow velocity                    
#                                      due to  geophysical effects.                                                                          
#                                     But can not be used to study the long-term variations because the result could                         
#                                      be biased by the uncertainty in Vx.                                                                   
#     MODS                            Version 1.0 Jan. 28, 2008
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 RS_K0_IPEI_20011228_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  RS_K0_IPEI
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      ROCSAT-1(FORMOSAT-1)/IPEI, Key Parameters
#     PI_NAME                         Shin-Yi Su
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  Institute of Space Science, National Central University, Taiwan, R.O.C.
#     MISSION_GROUP                   ROCSAT-1(FORMOSAT-1)/IPEI
#                                     !___ITM Data including Particles (space)
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     LINK_TEXT                       ROCSAT-1(FORMOSAT-1)/IPEI
#                                     HomePage
#     LINK_TITLE                      IPEI/SDDC
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://csrsddc.csrsr.ncu.edu.tw
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, centered, in NSSDC Epoch
#  2. Ion drift in S/C LVLH coordinates > x component = along the S/C trajectory vector
#       NOTES:  Ion drift in S/C LVLH coordinates (in ECI Frame of Reference):   x: along the S/C trajectory vector. y: opposite to angular momentum. z: toward the Earth Center.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:03:14 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Ion drift in S/C LVLH coordinates (in ECI Frame of Reference):   x: along the S/C trajectory vector. y: opposite to angular momentum. z: toward the Earth Center.
#
EPOCH                          VX_S/C
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms          m/sec
11-03-1999 00:00:00.000       315.420

#                                      from flow velocities, Vx, Vy, and Vz                                                                  
#                                     measured in the S/C coordinate system. Vx points along the S/C trajectory vector,                      
#                                      Vz is in the nadir direction,                                                                         
#                                     and Vy points to the right of the S/C trajectory vector (in the anti-angular                           
#                                      momentum direction).

#                                      Inertia Coordinate System (non-rotating) (ECI coordinate).

#                                      Fixed Coordinated System (rotate with the Earth) (ECF coordinate).

#                                      could be introduced to all geophysical flow components.                                               
#                                     4) VperpM_MF at low latitude is almost identical to (-Vz). No Vx is included                           
#                                      so that it is very reliable.
